definition[0]: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them
example[0]: Last year he donated $1,000 to cancer research.
definition[1]: to allow some blood or a body organ to be removed from your body so that it can be used in a hospital to help someone who is ill or injured
example[1]: people who volunteer to donate blood
definition[2]: to give money or something valuable to a person or organization in order to help them
example[2]: Laurance S. Rockefeller donated $21 million to Princeton University for a center to study and teach human values.
